intro: Mondia whitei, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, pale green flowers that are clustered in spikes, followed by spherical, woody fruits containing several seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
